alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Hamilton; Rhea; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 6:11PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Rhea, northeastern Sequatchie, Bledsoe and north central Hamilton Counties through 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/... At 711 PM EDT/611 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Dunlap, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Dunlap, Pikeville, Soddy-Daisy, Graysville, Flat Top Mountain, Mount Crest, Evensville, Palio and Brayton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
